extends GridSystem

        Constructor of InfluenceLayer.
        Parameters:
        width - Width of this layer.
        height - Height of this layer.
        resolution - Resolution = how many units inside parent GridSystem is one grid in this layer.

      • propagate

        public abstract void propagate()
        Propagates influences inside this layer. Will be implemented by extenders.

      • createParams

        public abstract void createParams()
        Creates parameters for this layer. Will be implemented by extenders.

      • getMap

        public double[][] getMap()

      • get

        public double get(int x,
                  int y)
        Returns influence at the specified location of the map. Doesn't perform any checks as to bounds safety.
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -
        Returns:
        Returns influence stored at position [y][x] inside this influence layer.

      • get

        public double get(int[] xy)
        Parameters:
        xy - Coordinates of influence value you want to get. [x, y]
        Returns:
        Returns influence value at specified location.

      • getNormalized

        public double getNormalized(int x,
                            int y)
        Returns the normalized influence stored at [x, y] location. Performs no checks for boundaries.
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -
        Returns:
        Returns normalized (in range [-1, 1]) influence value of passed location inside this layer.

      • multiplyLayer

        public InfluenceLayer multiplyLayer(InfluenceLayer l)
                             throws InfluenceCombinationException
        Multiplies this layer with supplied one.
        Parameters:
        l - Layer to combine with this layer.
        Returns:
        Returns this layer that has values multiplied by values of supplied layer.
        Throws:
        InfluenceCombinationException - If layers cannot be combined.

      • multiplyLayer

        public InfluenceLayer multiplyLayer(InfluenceLayer l,
                                    double w)
                             throws InfluenceCombinationException
        Multiplies this layer by the layer passed in arguments, if possible.
        During each multiplication, the value is multiplied by passed multiplier.
        Parameters:
        l - Layer that should be combined with this one.
        w - Weight that multiplies each value.
        Returns:
        Returns this layer which values were multiplied by values of passed layer.
        Throws:
        InfluenceCombinationException - If layers cannot be combined.

      • addToLayer

        public InfluenceLayer addToLayer(InfluenceLayer l)
                          throws InfluenceCombinationException
        Adds this and supplied layer together.
        Parameters:
        l - Layer that should be combined with this one.
        Returns:
        Returns this layer whose values were combined with values of the other layer.
        Throws:
        InfluenceCombinationException - If this and passed layer cannot be combined.

      • addToLayer

        public InfluenceLayer addToLayer(InfluenceLayer l,
                                 double w1,
                                 double w2)
                          throws InfluenceCombinationException
        Adds this and the supplied layer together by adding the values of this layer and multiplying them by given weight to values of passed layer, that are multiplied by the other passed weight.
        Parameters:
        l - Influence layer that should be added to this one.
        w1 - Weight by which every value of this layer should be multiplied.
        w2 - Weight by which every value of the other layer should be multiplied.
        Returns:
        Returns this layer that is this and the passed layer added together with respect to given weights.
        Throws:
        InfluenceCombinationException - If this and the other layer couldnt be combined.

      • inverse

        public void inverse()
        This just reverses the sign of every influence value in this map.

      • normalizeValue

        public double normalizeValue(double inf)
        Takes influence value and normalizes it to interval [-1, 1].
        Parameters:
        inf - Value to be normalized.
        Returns:
        Normalized value of the passed argument.

      • normalize

        public void normalize()
        Normalizes the whole layer, so that every influence value, including min and max, is in [-1,1] range.

      • saveToFile

        public void saveToFile(java.lang.String fileName)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Saves this influence layer to file. The file should be saved to working directory with specified fileName.
        The location will be specified inside logs, so consult them if you don't know where your working directory is.
        Parameters:
        fileName - What is the name of the file we are saving to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If I was unable to open the file etc.

        Parameters:

        e - BaseEntity reference.

      • findMinMax

        public MinMaxObject findMinMax(int startx,
                               int starty,
                               int xSize,
                               int ySize)
        Walks through a rectangle specified by startx, starty and size bounds. Finds its minimum, maximum and locations of such highpoints.
        Parameters:
        startx - Starting x coordinate.
        starty - Starting y coordintate.
        xSize - Width.
        ySize - Height.
        Returns:
        Returns MinMaxObject containing found min and max and its indices.

      • findMinOnGrid

        public double findMinOnGrid(int startx,
                            int starty,
                            int xSize,
                            int ySize)
        Returns minimum on specified rectangle.
        Parameters:
        startx - X top left corner of the rectangle.
        starty - Y top left corner of the rectangle.
        xSize - Width of the rectangle.
        ySize - Height of the rectangle.
        Returns:
        Returns double representing the minimum.

      • getFrontLine

        public java.util.ArrayList<FrontLine> getFrontLine()
        Returns:
        Returns ArrayList of FrontLines in left to right order. Front lines are objects that store locations on which there there is a swap in influence signs. (meaning influence going from positive to negative values and vice versa)

      • getMin

        public double getMin()
        The value can be Double.MAX_VALUE if no propagation occurred just yet or if it was just cleared.
        Returns:
        Returns minimum value from this layer.

        Parameters:
        min - New minimum to be set.

      • getMinOrigin

        public int[] getMinOrigin()
        Returns:
        Returns origin(location) of minimum peak. {-1,-1} if no such peak exist.
